3 Basic plots 3.1 Bar plots p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, fill = class)) + geom_bar(alpha = .75) + scale_fill_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) + theme_rethink() ggplotly(p, tooltip = "x") 3.1.1 Stacked bar plots Stacked bar plots can be used to add additional information to a bar plot. head(beaver1, n = 5) ## day time temp activ ## 1 346 840 36.33 0 ## 2 346 850 36.34 0 ## 3 346 900 36.35 0 ## 4 346 910 36.42 0 ## 5 346 920 36.55 0 The following graph is a stacked bar plot. p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, fill = drv)) + geom_bar(alpha = .75) + scale_fill_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) + theme_rethink() ggplotly(p) 3.2 Scatter plots 3.2.1 Simple scatter plot p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) + geom_point(alpha = .85) + theme_rethink() ggplotly(p) 3.2.2 Jittered scatter plot p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) + geom_jitter(alpha = .85, width = 0.5, height = 0.5) + theme_rethink() ggplotly(p, tooltip = "none") 3.2.3 Multiple scatter plot p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(cyl))) + geom_point(alpha = .85) + scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) + theme_rethink() ggplotly(p) 3.3 Line plots 3.3.1 Simple line plot p <- ggplot(economics, aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) + geom_line() + theme_rethink() ggplotly(p) 3.3.2 Multiple lines plot p <- ggplot(economics_long, aes(x = date, y = value01, color = variable)) + geom_line() + scale_color_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) + theme_rethink() ggplotly(p)
